Package oracle.kubernetes.operator.authentication

Class Authenticator

java.lang.Object
oracle.kubernetes.operator.authentication.Authenticator
public class Authenticator
extends java.lang.Object
This class contains methods to authenticate to the Kubernetes API Server in different ways and to create API clients with the desired credentials.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Authenticator()
    Create a new instace of the Authenticator class containing the default API client.
    Authenticator​(io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiClient apiClient)
    Create a new instance of Authenticator with the provided API Client.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void closeClient​(io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiClient apiClient)
    Close the ApiClient to make sure any open connection is cleaned up.
    io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiClient createClientByServiceAccountName​(java.lang.String serviceAccountName)
    Given a serviceAccountName (not restricted by namespace) create the authenticated client from secrets attached to that account.
    io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiClient createClientByServiceAccountName​(java.lang.String serviceAccountName, java.lang.String namespace)
    Given a serviceAccountName (restricted by namespace) create the authenticated client from secrets attached to that account.
    io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiClient createClientByToken​(java.lang.String token)
    Given a token look through all service accounts for a secret that matches the token.
    io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiClient getApiClient()
    Get the API client.

    Get a reference to ServiceHelper.

    Get the service token.

  • Constructor Details

    • Authenticator

      public Authenticator() throws java.io.IOException
      Create a new instace of the Authenticator class containing the default API client. The default client will normally use ~/.kube/config or the file pointed to by $KUBECONFIG outside a Kubernetes cluster, or the default Service Account inside a Kubernetes cluster (i.e. in a Container in a Pod).
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is an API error.

    • Authenticator

      public Authenticator​(io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiClient apiClient)
      Create a new instance of Authenticator with the provided API Client. Called by KubernetesClient class to setup client and config objects.
      Parameters:
      apiClient - The API Client to create the Authenticator with.

  • Method Details

    • getApiClient

      public io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiClient getApiClient()
      Get the API client.
      Returns:
      the ApiClient object.

    • getHelper

      public Helpers getHelper()
      Get a reference to ServiceHelper.
      Returns:
      the ServiceHelper object.

    • getServiceToken

      public java.lang.String getServiceToken()
      Get the service token.
      Returns:
      the ServiceToken object.

    • createClientByToken

      public io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiClient createClientByToken​(java.lang.String token) throws io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiException
      Given a token look through all service accounts for a secret that matches the token. Then create an authenticated client for that service account.
      Parameters:
      token - service token for search.
      Returns:
      ApiClient that has been properly authenticated
      Throws:
      io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiException - on API Exception

    • createClientByServiceAccountName

      public io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiClient createClientByServiceAccountName​(java.lang.String serviceAccountName) throws io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiException
      Given a serviceAccountName (not restricted by namespace) create the authenticated client from secrets attached to that account.
      Parameters:
      serviceAccountName - The name of the Service Account.
      Returns:
      ApiClient that has been properly authenticated.
      Throws:
      io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiException - if the API call fails.

    • createClientByServiceAccountName

      public io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiClient createClientByServiceAccountName​(java.lang.String serviceAccountName, java.lang.String namespace) throws io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiException
      Given a serviceAccountName (restricted by namespace) create the authenticated client from secrets attached to that account.
      Parameters:
      serviceAccountName - The name of the Service Account.
      namespace - The name of the Namespace.
      Returns:
      ApiClient that has been properly authenticated.
      Throws:
      io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiException - if there is an API error.

    • closeClient

      public void closeClient​(io.kubernetes.client.openapi.ApiClient apiClient)
      Close the ApiClient to make sure any open connection is cleaned up.
      Parameters:
      apiClient - ApiClient object that you want to close.
